attractions.name: Secret Rooftop Garden
attractions.description: Hidden oasis above the city with panoramic views and exotic plants. A peaceful escape featuring rare botanical specimens and stunning sunset vistas over Buenos Aires.
attractions.tips: Enter through the old Galería building, take elevator to top floor
attractions.historicalInfo: Created in 1987 by local artist Maria Santos as a community green space.

attractions.name: Underground Art Gallery
attractions.description: Former subway tunnel transformed into a vibrant underground art space showcasing local street artists and experimental installations.
attractions.tips: Look for the metal door with graffiti murals, open Tuesday-Sunday
attractions.historicalInfo: Abandoned subway tunnel from 1920s, converted to art space in 2015.

attractions.name: Historic Clock Tower
attractions.description: 19th-century clock tower with original mechanisms still functioning. Offers guided tours and incredible city views from the observation deck.
attractions.tips: Book tours in advance, wear comfortable shoes for climbing
attractions.historicalInfo: Built in 1889, served as the city's main timekeeper for over 80 years.

attractions.name: Hidden Waterfall Trail
attractions.description: Short hiking trail leading to a secluded waterfall in the heart of the urban area. Perfect for nature photography and quiet reflection.
attractions.tips: Bring mosquito repellent and water, trail can be muddy after rain
attractions.historicalInfo: Natural spring discovered by early settlers in 1800s.

attractions.name: Vintage Record Shop Basement
attractions.description: Hidden basement venue beneath a record shop hosting intimate acoustic performances and open mic nights. Features rare vinyl collection.
attractions.tips: Entry through record shop, check social media for event schedule
attractions.historicalInfo: Operating since 1975, discovered many now-famous local musicians.

attractions.name: Forgotten Cemetery Garden
attractions.description: Small 18th-century cemetery with beautiful old headstones and peaceful garden setting. Rich in local genealogy and historical stories.
attractions.tips: Respectful behavior required, great for historical research
attractions.historicalInfo: Established in 1750, contains graves of city founders.

attractions.name: Artisan Workshop Alley
attractions.description: Narrow alley lined with traditional craftspeople's workshops. Watch glassblowing, pottery, and woodworking demonstrations.
attractions.tips: Narrow passages, watch for working artists, purchases welcome
attractions.historicalInfo: Traditional craftspeople have worked here for over 100 years.

attractions.name: Secret Beach Cove
attractions.description: Small hidden beach accessible through rocky outcrop. Perfect for sunrise photography and peaceful meditation away from crowds.
attractions.location: Costanera Norte, near Jorge Newbery Field
attractions.tips: Careful climbing required, bring flashlight for early morning visits
attractions.historicalInfo: Hidden cove used by fishermen since early 1900s.

attractions.name: Abandoned Theater Ruins
attractions.description: Remnants of a grand 1920s theater with stunning architectural details still visible. Now serves as an outdoor performance space.
attractions.tips: Watch for uneven surfaces, sometimes hosts pop-up performances
attractions.historicalInfo: Grand Palace Theater operated 1923-1978, damaged by fire.

attractions.name: Rooftop Beehive Garden
attractions.description: Urban beekeeping project with observation hives and honey tastings. Educational tours about urban agriculture and bee conservation.
attractions.tips: Book tours online, suitable for families, honey available for purchase
attractions.historicalInfo: Started in 2018 as part of urban sustainability initiative.

attractions.name: Hidden Speakeasy Cave
attractions.description: Original Prohibition-era speakeasy preserved underground. Now serves craft cocktails in authentic 1920s atmosphere with live jazz.
attractions.tips: Password required (changes weekly), dress code enforced

attractions.name: Miniature Fairy Door Trail
attractions.description: Whimsical trail featuring tiny fairy doors hidden in trees and rocks throughout the park. Great for families with children.
attractions.location: Parque Tres de Febrero, hidden paths
attractions.tips: Bring camera, look carefully at tree bases and rock formations
attractions.historicalInfo: Created by local artist collective in 2020 during pandemic.

attractions.name: Telescope Observatory Deck
attractions.description: Community-run telescope facility offering stargazing sessions and astronomy education. Features both historical and modern equipment.
attractions.tips: Check weather forecast, warm clothes recommended for night viewing

attractions.name: Ancient Tree Grove
attractions.description: Collection of 300+ year old trees in urban setting. Some of the oldest living things in the city with informational plaques.
attractions.tips: Peaceful spot for reading, benches available, guided tours on weekends
attractions.historicalInfo: Trees planted by original city planners in 1700s.

attractions.name: Graffiti Hall of Fame
attractions.description: Legal graffiti wall showcasing rotating street art from local and visiting artists. Features a museum of hip-hop culture.
attractions.tips: Artists often work on-site, photography encouraged, respect the art
attractions.historicalInfo: Established in 1986 as legal space for street artists.

attractions.name: Meditation Labyrinth
attractions.description: Stone labyrinth for walking meditation in quiet garden setting. Includes benches and reflection areas for peaceful contemplation.
attractions.tips: Maintain silence, remove shoes if comfortable, donations welcome

metadata.author: Albert Silva
metadata.project: WDD 231 Final Project - Hidden Gems Explorer
metadata.description: Curated collection of hidden gems and secret attractions in Buenos Aires, Argentina
